articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, MIKE BALSAMO, ERIC TUCKER and TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. is investigating an unauthorized release of classified documents that assess Israel's plans to attack Iran, three U.S. officials told The Associated Press. A fourth U.S. official said the documents appear to be legitimate.
articles.title: US investigating unauthorized release of classified documents on Israel attack plans

articles.author: ADAM SCHRECK and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel's government said a drone targeted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s house Saturday, with no casualties, as fighting with Lebanon-based Hezbollah and Gaza -based Hamas showed no pause after the killing of the Hamas mastermind of last year’s Oct.
articles.title: A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah

articles.author: SARAH EL DEEB and FATMA KHALED
articles.description: The world’s final glimpse of Hamas’ leader was rough and raw, showing him wounded and cornered as he sat in a bombed-out Palestinian home and faced down the Israeli drone filming him, hurling a stick at it.
articles.title: In Israeli footage of the last minutes of Hamas leader's life, some see a symbol of defiance

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN and CHARLOTTE KRAMON
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris said Saturday that Republican former President Donald Trump was “cruel” for how he talked about the grieving family of a Georgia mother who died after waiting 20 hours for a hospital to treat her complications from an abortion pill, as she put combating restrictions on reproductive care at the center of her pitch to voters.
articles.title: Harris says Trump is 'cruel' as she spotlights abortion restrictions in Georgia during early voting

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: LATROBE, Pa. (AP) — Donald Trump's campaign suggested he would begin previewing his closing argument Saturday night with Election Day barely two weeks away.
articles.title: Trump kicks off a Pennsylvania rally by talking about Arnold Palmer's genitalia

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — Authorities said at least seven people were killed Saturday when part of a ferry dock collapsed on Georgia's Sapelo Island, where crowds had gathered for a fall celebration by the island's tiny Gullah-Geechee community of Black slave descendants.
articles.title: At least 7 dead after ferry dock gangway collapses on Georgia's Sapelo Island

articles.author: MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Over the past four years, judges at Washington’s federal courthouse have punished hundreds of rioters who stormed the U.S. Capitol in an unprecedented assault on the nation's democracy.
articles.title: Judges punishing Jan. 6 rioters say they fear more political violence as Election Day nears

articles.author: MARK KENNEDY
articles.description: CLEVELAND (AP) — Hollywood stars Julia Roberts and Zendaya bookended Saturday’s inductions into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, giving a little stardust to an eclectic lineup that included pop icon Cher, heavy metal’s Ozzy Osbourne, hip-hop soul queen Mary J.
articles.title: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame turns up starpower to induct Cher, Foreigner, Mary J. Blige, Ozzy and more

articles.author: PHILIP MARCELO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Manhattan’s famed luxury store row Fifth Avenue is in line for a major makeover.New York City officials unveiled a plan this week to transform a central portion of the thoroughfare between Bryant Park and Central Park into a more pedestrian-centered boulevard.
articles.title: NYC officials envision turning Fifth Avenue into a grand boulevard

articles.author: TOM WITHERS
articles.description: CLEVELAND (AP) — Juan Soto's arrival last winter was supposed to be that move that pushed the New York Yankees back to the top.They're one step away.Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning and the Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series — and first in 15 years — by beating the Cleveland Guardians 5-2 in Game 5 of the AL Championship Series on Saturday night.
articles.title: Juan Soto's 3-run homer in 10th sends Yankees past Guardians 5-2 and into World Series for 41st time
